meanings.definition: To spell better or more accurately than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always outspells her classmates in the spelling bee.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys outspelling his friends in spelling competitions.
meanings.sent3: The little girl outspelling her older brother was a sight to see.
meanings.sent4: His ability to outspell others made him the champion of the spelling contest.
meanings.sent5: Outspelling the competition, she confidently spelled each word flawlessly.

meanings.definition: The act of spelling words correctly or accurately.
meanings.sent1: His outspelling of complex words impressed the judges.
meanings.sent2: The teacher praised her student's outspelling during the test.
meanings.sent3: The outspelling of the word 'onomatopoeia' brought a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent4: Her outspelling was so precise that she never made a mistake.
meanings.sent5: The outspelling of challenging words became his favorite hobby.
